00048 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00049 
00050 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00051 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00052 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00053 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00054 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00055 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00056 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00057 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00058 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00059 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00061 typedef struct {
00062 
00063     volatile unsigned long lock;
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00065     const char *file;
00066     const char *function;
00067     unsigned line;
00068     int cpu;
00069 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00070 } xnlock_t;
00071 
00072 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00073 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00074 #else
00075 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00076         0,                                      \
00077         NULL,                                   \
00078         0,                                      \
00079         -1                                      \
00080         }
00081 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00082 
00083 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00084 
00085 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00086 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00087 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00088 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00089     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00090 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00100 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00101 
00102 static inline spl_t
00103 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00104 {
00105     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00106 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00107 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00108 {
00109 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00110     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00111     unsigned long flags;
00112 
00113     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00114 
00115     adeos_load_cpuid();
00116 
00117     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00118         {
00119         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00120             /* Use an non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00121                bit_spin_lock. */
00122             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00123                 {
00124                 cpu_relax();
00125 
00126 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00127                 if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00128                     {
00129                     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00130                     printk(KERN_ERR
00131                            "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00132                            "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00133                            "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00134                            lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00135                            lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00136                     show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00137                     for (;;)
00138                         safe_halt();
00139                     }
00140 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00141                 }
00142 
00143 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00144         lock->file = file;
00145         lock->function = function;
00146         lock->line = line;
00147         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00148 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00149         }
00150     else
00151         flags |= 2;
00152 
00153     return flags;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00157 
00158 {
00159     if (!(flags & 2))
00160         {
00161         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00162 
00163         rthal_cli();
00164 
00165         adeos_load_cpuid();
00166 
00167         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00168             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00169         }
00170 
00171     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00172 }
00173 
00174 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00175 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00176 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00177 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00178 
00179 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00180 
00181 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00182 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00183 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00184 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00185 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00186 
00187 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00191 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00192 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00193 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00194    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00195    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00196    timer interrupt instead. */
00197 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00198 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00199 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00200 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00249 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00250 
00251     /* Kernel mode side */
00252     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00253     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00254     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00255     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00256     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00257 
00258     /* User mode side */
00259     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00260     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00261 
00262     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00263     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00264     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00265 
00266 } xnarchtcb_t;
00267

00294 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00295     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00296 }
00297 
00298 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00299     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00300 }
00301 
00302 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00303     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00304 }
00305 
00306 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00307     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00308 }

00310 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00311     return adeos_processor_id();
00312 }
00313 
00314 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00315 
00316 {
00317     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00318         return vmalloc(bytes);
00319 
00320     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00321 }
00322 
00323 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00324 
00325 {
00326     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00327         vfree(chunk);
00328     else
00329         kfree(chunk);
00330 }
00331 
00332 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00333 {
00334     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00335 }

00341 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00342 do { \
00343     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00344     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00345     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00346     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00347 } while(0)

00352 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00353 
00354 {
00355     spl_t s;
00356     splhigh(s);
00357     splexit(!!imask);
00358     return !!s;
00359 }

00420 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00421 
00422 {
00423     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00424 
00425     adeos_load_cpuid();
00426 
00427     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00428        and always inside a critical section. */
00429     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00430     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00431     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00432     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00433     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00434 }
00435 
00436 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00437 {
00438     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00439 }
00440 
00441 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00442                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00443                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00444                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00445                                     )
00446 {
00447 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00448 
00449     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00450         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00451         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00452         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00453         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00454         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00455         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00456         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00457         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00458         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00459         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00460         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00461         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00462         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00463         "ret\n\t" \
00464 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00465         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00466         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00467       : /* no output */ \
00468       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00469         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00470         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00471         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00472         "b" (out_tcb), \
00473         "S" (in_tcb), \
00474         "a" (outproc), \
00475         "d" (inproc));
00476 
00477 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00478 
00479     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00480     
00481     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00482         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00483         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00484         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00485         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00486         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00487         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00488         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00489         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00490         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00491         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00492         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00493         "ret\n\t" \
00494 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00495       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00496         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00497         "=S" (esi_out), \
00498         "=D" (edi_out), \
00499         "+a" (outproc), \
00500         "+d" (inproc) \
00501       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00502         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00503         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00504         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00505 
00506 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00507 }
00508 
00509 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00510                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00511 {
00512     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00513     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00514 
00515     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00516         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00517            clear the ts bit. */
00518         clts();
00519     
00520     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00521 
00522     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00523         {
00524         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00525 
00526         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00527 
00528         if (!inproc->mm)
00529             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00530         }
00531 
00532     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00533 
00534     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00535 
00536         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00537            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00538            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00539            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00540            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00541            raw I/O ops. */
00542 
00543         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00544 
00545         barrier();
00546 
00547         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00548             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, adeos_processor_id());
00549 
00550             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00551                 
00552                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00553 
00554                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00555                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00556                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00557                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00558 
00559                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00560                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00561             }
00562         }
00563     }
00564 
00565     stts();
00566 }
00567 
00568 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00569                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00570 {
00571     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00572 }
00573 
00574 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00575 {
00576     /* Empty */
00577 }
00578 
00579 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00580                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00581                                          const char *name)
00582 {
00583     tcb->user_task = current;
00584     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00585     tcb->esp = 0;
00586     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00587     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00588     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00589 }
00590 
00591 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00592                                                int imask,
00593                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00594                                                void *cookie)
00595 {
00596     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00597     stts();
00598     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00599     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00600     entry(cookie);
00601     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00602 }
00603 
00604 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00605                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00606                                        void *cookie,
00607                                        int imask,
00608                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00609                                        char *name)
00610 {
00611     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00612 
00613     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00614     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00615     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00616     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00617     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00618     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00619     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00620     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00621     *--(*psp) = 0;
00622 }
00623 
00624 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00625 
00626 #define xnarch_enable_fpu(current_tcb) clts()
00627 
00628 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00629 
00630 {
00631     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00632        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00633 
00634     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00635 
00636     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00637         {
00638         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00639         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00640         }
00641 }
00642 
00643 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00644 
00645 {
00646     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00647         {
00648         clts();
00649 
00650         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00651             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00652         else
00653             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00654         }
00655 }
00656 
00657 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00658 
00659 {
00660     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00661 
00662     if (task)
00663         {
00664         if (!task->used_math)
00665             {
00666             stts();
00667             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00668             }
00669 
00670         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00671            hardware. */
00672         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00673         }
00674 
00675     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00676        user-space or kernel thread. */
00677 
00678     clts();
00679 
00680     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00681         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00682     else
00683         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00684 }
00685 
00686 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00687 
00688 #define xnarch_enable_fpu(current_tcb)
00689 
00690 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00691 
00692 {}
00693 
00694 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00695 
00696 {}
00697 
00698 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00699 
00700 {}
00701 
00702 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00703 
00704 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00705 
00706 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00707 
00708     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00709 }
00710 
00711 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00712 
00713 {
00714     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00715                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00716                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00717                                      NULL,
00718                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00719 }
00720 
00721 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00722 
00723 {
00724     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00725                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00726                                      NULL,
00727                                      NULL,
00728                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00729 }
00730 
00731 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00732 
00733 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00734 {
00735     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00736 }
00737 
00738 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00739     
00740 {
00741     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00742     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00743     unsigned long flags;
00744     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00745 
00746     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00747 
00748     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00749        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00750        context. */
00751     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00752                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00753 
00754     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00755     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00756     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00757     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00758 
00759     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00760         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00761     
00762     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00763                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00764 }
00765 
00766 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00767 
00768 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00769 
00770     return 0;
00771 }
00772 
00773 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00774 
00775     return 0;
00776 }
00777 
00778 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00779 
00780     return 0;
00781 }
00782 
00783 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00784 
00785 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00786 
00787 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00788 
00789 {
00790 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00791     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00792        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00793     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00794 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00795 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00796     xnshadow_release_events();
00797 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00798     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00799     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00800     schedule_timeout(50);
00801     xnarch_release_ipi();
00802 }
00803 
00804 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00805 
00806 {
00807     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00808 
00809     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00810         {
00811         spl_t s;
00812         splsync(s);
00813         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00814         splexit(s);
00815         return 1;
00816         }
00817 
00818     return 0;
00819 }
00820 
00821 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00822 
00823 {
00824 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00825     xnshadow_grab_events();
00826 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00827 }
00828 
00829 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00833 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00834 {
00835     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00836     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00837     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00838     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00839     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00840     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00841 }
00842 
00843 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */

00845 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00846 
00847 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00848                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00849                                            const char *name)
00850 {
00851     struct task_struct *task = current;
00852 
00853     tcb->user_task = task;
00854     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00855     tcb->esp = 0;
00856     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00857     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00858     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00859 }
00860 
00861 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00862 
00863 {
00864     unsigned irq;
00865 
00866     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00867         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00868                              handler,
00869                              NULL,
00870                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00871 }
00872 
00873 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00874 
00875 {
00876     unsigned irq;
00877 
00878     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00879         {
00880         switch (irq)
00881             {
00882 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00883             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00884             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00885             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00886             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00887 
00888                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00889                 continue;
00890 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00891 
00892             default:
00893 
00894                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00895             }
00896         }
00897 }
00898 
00899 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00900 
00901 {
00902     unsigned irq;
00903 
00904     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00905         {
00906         switch (irq)
00907             {
00908 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00909             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00910             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00911             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00912             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00913 
00914                 continue;
00915 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00916 
00917             default:
00918 
00919                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00920             }
00921         }
00922 }
00923 
00924 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00926 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00927 
00928 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00929     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00930        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00931        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00932        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00933     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00934 }
00935 
00936 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00937     rthal_release_timer();
00938 }
00939 
00940 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00941 
00942 {
00943 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00944     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00945 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00946     return 0;
00947 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00948 }
00949 
00950 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00951                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00952                                         unsigned long long defval)
00953 {
00954 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00955     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00956     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00957     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00958 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00959     *shot = defval;
00960     *delivery = defval;
00961 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00962 }
00963 
00964 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00969 
00970 {
00971     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00972     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00973     hcb->heapbase = NULL;

00976 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00977                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00978                                           unsigned long paddr,
00979                                           unsigned long size,
00980                                           pgprot_t prot)
00981 {
00982 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,10)
00983     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00984 #else /* Linux version < 2.6.10 */
00985     return remap_page_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr,size,prot);
00986 #endif /* Linux version >= 2.6.10 */
00987 }

00989 #endif /* XENO_HEAP_MODULE */

00991 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00992 
00993 #include <linux/init.h>
00994 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00995 
00996 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00997 
00998 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00999 
01000 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
01001 
01002 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
01003 
01004 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
01005 
01006 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
01007 
01008 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
01009 {
01010     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
01011 
01012     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
01013     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
01014     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
01015 
01016     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
01017 }
01018 
01019 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
01020 
01021 {
01022 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
01023     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
01024 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
01025     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
01026        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
01027        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
01028        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
01029        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
01030        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
01031     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer()) ?: 1;
01032 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
01033 }
01034 
01035 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
01036 
01037 {
01038     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
01039 
01040     if (!nktimerlat)
01041         return -ENODEV;
01042 
01043     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
01044 
01045     return 0;
01046 }
01047 
01048 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
01049 
01050 {
01051     int err;
01052 
01053 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01054     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
01055        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
01056     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
01057 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
01058 
01059     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
01060 
01061     if (err)
01062         return err;
01063 
01064     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
01065 
01066     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
01067         return -ENOSYS;
01068 
01069     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
01070                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
01071                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
01072                               NULL,
01073                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
01074 
01075     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
01076 
01077 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01078     err = xnshadow_mount();
01079 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01080 
01081     if (err)
01082         {
01083         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01084         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01085         }
01086 
01087     return err;
01088 }
01089 
01090 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
01091 
01092 {
01093 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01094     xnshadow_cleanup();
01095 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01096     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01097     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01098 }
01099 
01100 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
01101 
01102 #ifdef __cplusplus
01103 }
01104 #endif
